Title: Failed/Outstanding/Completed with Warnings Backup Report - Networker & VMS
Brief Description: Create a backup report of all failed/outstanding/Completed with warning backups from the night before and list them in 1 SD to Open Systems Support along with the comment section which includes total number of client failures on each backup. You can use the report tab macro on the backup checksheet and attach this to SD saved on this tab.
Comments: This should be performed by whoever is on backup checksheet at this time, if you are not working the backup sheet then you must ensure that it has been completed with SD numbers placed in the backup checksheet before signing off.

Title: STRATE recon process
Brief Description:
Check the email generated by the strate recon process. If successful it will say The DCL CCS_CSDP_RECON.COM has been submitted.
If the files are not found in disk$export:[strate] by 17:30 SA Time (15:30 GMT) escalate to SA ITPSG.
(excluding SA Bank Holidays)

Title: Bank File Processing
Brief Description:
Release the FNB_PRE_BANK_PROCESS job on the HOUSEKEEPINGBANK  queue
The BANK_FILE_PROCESS job on the HOUSEKEEPINGBANK queue can now be released as long as the above job has completed and all Bank files have been received. If not, investigate and escalate to the Shift Manager
Notes: NOTE: The Bank File Process job MUST run before the ACCURATE_BANKFEED_CONCAT job at 21:00 ? If a Bank file is going to be delayed for longer than this, then the Bank_File_Process job should be run when the rest of files have been received, then run again as soon as the ?problem? file is delivered

Title: SMS Message Test

Title: HML Batch processing schedule
Brief Description:
Ensure that Client support requests (App support) have emailed us the HML processing schedules for HMLPMSL, HMLPPHS and HMLPHLM.
*On Fridays, we should receive either a set of schedules if there is processing due to take place, or a confirmation email stating that there is no additional processing.*
If not received by 16:30 you will need to email ClientSupportRequests@hml.co.uk and query this. Make sure these are checked and any irregularites are checked with App Support - then put them in the HANDOVER (not completed) folder.
Notes: IMPORTANT: If any jobs are on hold in JCM but are missing from the Processing schedule then please enquire with the Client support team.

Title: Dual Logging Test/Check
Brief Description:
Test that disabling and enabling Dual Logging on a company works for all four clusters.
$ dlog/dual=disable (company code)
$ dlog/dual=enable (company code)
Use any company for these tests.
Dual Logging Check
Check Dual Logging is not disabled for any companies and re-enable if necessary.
$ dlog * /show=disabled  (to check)
$ dlog/dual=enable COY  (to enable)
Comments:
$ dlog/dual=disable (company code)

$ dlog/dual=enable (company code)
$ dlog * /show=disabled  (to check)
$ dlog/dual=enable COY  (to enable)

Title: Purge Dual Logging Files
Brief Description:
Purge all old Dual Logging log files.
$ dlog */purge/keep=12

Check the result is as expected using
$ dir SCRIP$BK_LOG:[rbos]rbos*.log;*

The number of files should equal the number in the /keep part of the command. If there are more than 12 files, but they?re a different version of the file (e.g. ;3) this is OK.
